New Records: Memphis Grizzlies set a new record with 28 stocks (steals + blocks) in the game, the highest since November 8, 2002
Key Match Events: Memphis Grizzlies won the game against the Portland Trail Blazers with a 134-89 scoreline
Jake LaRavia contributed with 18 points, four rebounds, three steals, and three blocks
Luke Kennard had a career-high 11 assists and showcased his playmaking abilities
Pre-Game Insights: The Grizzlies' starting lineup lacked key players like Ja Morant, Desmond Bane, and Marcus Smart
The team emphasized depth and defensive activity as key strengths
The absence of star players highlighted the importance of role players like Jake LaRavia and Zach Edey
Post-Match Reflections: The victory demonstrated the Grizzlies' depth and ability to perform without their key players
The team's five wins in the past six games indicated strong performance and cohesion
Miscellaneous Highlights: The defensive impact of Jay Huff and Zach Edey was crucial to the game's outcome
The Grizzlies' offensive versatility was highlighted by Luke Kennard's playmaking
The win was seen as a crucial step in the team's journey
